document.full_text: a new study suggests that surgeons who treat a high proportion of hispanic patients tend to be less happy with their jobs than their peers -- a difference, researchers say, that may have much to do with language and cultural barriers.
document.title: culture barrier may affect surgeon job satisfaction
lines_and_colors: a new study suggests that surgeons who treat a high proportion of hispanic patients tend to be less happy with their jobs than their peers -- a difference, researchers say, that may have much to do with language and cultural barriers.
